lenders.name: Eric

lenders.occupational_info: I like Kiva, and I love Jesus.

lenders.name: Marco
lenders.loan_because: we can

lenders.name: Julia
lenders.loan_because:
I want to level the playing field by providing short - term microloans or medium - term housing microloans to people in need. I want transparency. I oppose huge loans. I want Kiva to mark the partner pages as self descriptions of partners and provide all the info that might be necessary to make an informed decision about the partners on a separate page. I expect Kiva to avoid even the impression of entanglement with any partner. _____________________________________________________________  I oppose Kiva´s partnership with Opus Dei because its undertaking, Strathmore, is no bank but a private *educational* institution and from the information that the GLBT team provided I draw the conclusion that Opus Dei works against women´s rights expecting them to think of themselves as carpets for others to step on [from the book "Gottes rechte Kirche"] ___________________________________________________________________ I feel that Kiva management has not provided any info whatsoever so far when being asked.____________________________________ _Kiva has opened its African headquarters on the campus of Strathmore University. When some lenders complained Matt Flannery said that Kiva could move anytime. He gave no information on why they didn´t plan to move. Even if there was no connection: If I led a charity and many lenders said they saw a problem with me renting bureaus from a certain organisation I would move to another location. If I stayed I would have to give detailed info on why exactly this spot it so great for me to stay at. _____________________________________________________________

If someone said one of my managers had a business connection that might create a conflict of interest I would address the issue, clarify what kind of business relationship there was and explain why I thought this did not pose a conflict of interest.

If lenders said that huge education loans were a mission shift away from the core mission I would discuss this._________________________________________________________

I found this article from Bilgrimage blogspot very interesting and I link it below:

"What I am saying is that the lack of transparency and honesty among Kiva's top leaders about their thick connections to Laurent Drion, who has been presented to us Kiva supporters as merely an exemplary altruist and certainly not as a venture capitalist moving electronic goods in Africa, has caused the Kiva-Strathmore deal to appear in a less than savory light--at least in the eyes of many of us. This is true a fortiori because Opus Dei has a well-documented history of seeking to recruit corporate and business elites through ties to business schools--schools exactly like Strathmore.___________________________________

Opus Dei is all about massaging capitalist elites to do the work of Christ, and doing that work without accountability and transparency--with the implication that Opus Dei's work is self-evidently and automatically good. Because it's for Christ, of course. And for capitalism . . . ."___________
This is Kiva staff´s latest response which I just found on the website but haven´t gone through,yet:
http://blog.kiva.org/faqs/strathmore-qa
lenders.occupational_info:
I help that the things our customers want delivered get to their customers.

Tradition is to preserve the fire and not to pray to the ashes. 
(Gustav Mahler)

This is a link to a German show called Volker Pispers explaining the System: debt, pensions and Switzerland that provides a good explanation of how pensions can work shown at the example of Switzerland and how the German pension system could be better
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZRoMP_V3zDU

Due to recent events I link an article about Kiva and Strathmore. I won´t make donations and only few loans until this is settled.

We do a lot of volunteer work through our business directly and are grateful for more opportunities to help in other ways such as through Kiva.

lenders.name: vivian
lenders.loan_because: Hopefully i want to expand my business from sari sari store to grocery store.

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: funds allow people to put their ideas into reality.

lenders.name: Ginger
lenders.loan_because: This is a great way to lend a helping hand to others so that they have the opportunity to succeed in their dream of entrepreneuership and creating greater success and contribution in their families and their communities, while at the same time allowing them the means for developing the self esteem tied to making a business successful.
lenders.occupational_info: My occupation allows me to help others build and implement their business and sales plans. I enjoy hiking, biking, study and travel when I'm not working.

lenders.name: Justin
lenders.occupational_info: Industrial Automation

lenders.name: Ferreira Family
lenders.loan_because: we have been blessed with our family and health so we are paying it forward.

lenders.name: Robert Han Bishop
lenders.loan_because: It is a way of helping others to help themselves, and restores the funds to me so I can help others, It seems to be  a win-win solution for all involved.
lenders.occupational_info: I help others to Connect with their Higher Guidance, and then learn to Trust that as the Guiding Spirit of their lives. This opens them to discovering and living their own unique expression of Life Purpose.

lenders.name: Julian
lenders.loan_because: It's nice to be able to see something you've contributed to become successful.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an artist who makes paintings.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on the selling of films. I am also a photographer.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: ultimately we are all global citizens; lending money seems a great way for me to help people in developing countries reach their financial goals.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a high school counseling students on everything from personal issues, to course selection to career and college planning.

lenders.name: Penny
lenders.loan_because: I believe it is a responsibility to give back to others for the gifts that we receive.

lenders.name: GASTON
lenders.loan_because: I believe in providing people with opportunities to improve their own lives and those around them.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: it is an effective and efficient way to give back.

lenders.name: Cathy
lenders.occupational_info: I would describe my work as a job I really enjoy doing  cause I get to meet people from all culytures & background. I get  to asociate  with people every day and thats good cause I enjoy meeting people & getting to know them. I also get along well with others.

lenders.name: Ruth
lenders.loan_because: It's a good thing to do and my sister-in-law gave me the info.

lenders.name: Mohamed
lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do. I am a small business owner myself, so I like helping others in the same situation.
lenders.occupational_info: Computer security consulting.

lenders.name: Ester
lenders.loan_because: I rather prefer to use the money I earn by helping others who need it.
lenders.occupational_info: Teaching language and art feels like you are opening the door to many countries, many cultures to the children. Make them see that difference is part of our world. Understand it and respect it.

lenders.name: Bree
lenders.loan_because: Being a business owner myself, I can understand the struggles and tribulations of starting a business. But I can only imagine the difficulties it would be for someone in a country where money and resources are very limited. The more you help others, the better you feel! And the better you feel, the more wonderful your life will be!

lenders.name: Warwick Stuart
lenders.loan_because: We want to give others the opportunity to make a start in business, improve their situation so that they can give back to their community.
lenders.occupational_info:
We build websites for small to medium businesses and non-profit organisations, 
Provide IT Professional Services, 
We have a website called http://Motorcycleridingcentral.com that provides information and sell products and
We provide Coaching and Mentoring services.

Phil and Chris

lenders.name: Dag-Roar
lenders.loan_because: Everybody can contribute to fight poverty! Teach my kids how bad the situation is for poor people, educate them on this important issue.

lenders.name: Anita
lenders.loan_because: I wish to help women less fortunate than myself to empower themselves and to educate their children.
lenders.occupational_info: Education in the fields of communication, speech, drama and dance.  I work mainly with young children.

lenders.name: Helen
lenders.loan_because: I believe we all have a responsibility to facilitate each other in whatever way we can and whenever we can. Charity although helpful has its limits, whereas microfinance is more than an economic resource it also gives the recipient a sense of worth, responsibility and the opportunity to take control of their own destiny. Something we in the West take for granted.
lenders.occupational_info: Teach at a University

lenders.name: Kimberly
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy the idea of my money making a positive difference in someone's life. God has blessed me to have a little money left over, so figured I would bless others with it

lenders.name: Kevin Magee
lenders.loan_because: I believe that having the courage to create, the tenacity to succeed and the drive to make ones dreams manifest are the foundations of a successful business, a fulfilling life and a better world. It is my sincere pleasure to assist those that share my beliefs in the pursuit and realization of their own dreams.

lenders.name: Samson
lenders.loan_because: I give a shit.

lenders.loan_because: This is a brilliant way to directly help someone help themselves.
